Query.name: Reversibility
Query.description: It is always possible to recover to <SM>

Query.name: Reversibility stronger
Query.description: It is always possible to recover to <SM> without further degradation

Query.name: Recoverability
Query.description: It is always possible to recover to <DegradedState> from <WorserDegradedState>

Query.name: Recoverability stronger
Query.description: It is always possible to recover to <DegradedState> from <WorserDegradedState> without degradation

Query.name: Threat consequence (single occurrence)
Query.description: Does a single occurrence of <M> provoke a system degradation?

Query.name: Threat consequence (multiple occurrence)
Query.description: Does (multiple) occurrence of <M> provoke a system degradation?

Query.name: Security level threat impact (single occurrence)
Query.description: Given the Full Service Mode, which is the service mode reached by a single occurrence of <M>

Query.name: Security level threat impact (multiple occurrence)
Query.description: Given the Full Service Mode, which is the service mode reached by (multiple) occurrence of <M>

Query.name: Threat scenario
Query.description: Given the Full Service Mode, which is the smallest set of misuses that leads to <DegradedState>

Query.name: Multiple recovery feasibility
Query.description: The strategies <R> are always needed together

Query.name: Recovery mutual exclusion
Query.description: The strategies <R> are never enabled together

Query.name: Threat/recovery effectiveness
Query.description: Is the strategy <R> effective to mitigate the threat <M> ?

Query.name: Best set of strategies in a service mode
Query.description: Among the feasible strategies in <S>, which is the smallest set of strategies that leads to the Full Service Mode
